alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morgan, southeastern Bath, northeastern Menifee and southwestern Rowan Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marshall, or near Owingsville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Olympia Springs and Ramey around 450 PM EDT. Salt Lick and Midland around 455 PM EDT. Young Springs and Farmers around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Sudith, Freestone, Bluestone, Frenchburg, Ratlitt, Cogswell, Yale, Zilpo, Scranton, Wellington, Big Woods, Bangor, Dan, Ebon, Korea, Paragon, Artville, Kellacey and Zag. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 120 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
